Uses of Interface
org.pojava.persistence.factories.SerialFactory

Packages that use SerialFactory
org.pojava.persistence.factories Factories construct objects, and are used for custom serialization of objects, often either to optimize the serialization output or to support serialized objects with specialized constructors. 
org.pojava.persistence.serial The serial package of POJava Persistence provides serialization and deserialization of Java Objects to and from XML. 
 

Uses of SerialFactory in org.pojava.persistence.factories
 

Classes in org.pojava.persistence.factories that implement SerialFactory
 class DateFactory<T>
          DateFactory provides serialization for the java.util.Date and its derived objects up to millisecond precision.
 class DateTimeFactory<T>
          The DateTimeFactory is a factory for handling objects compatible with the DateTime class.
 class DefaultFactory
          The DefaultFactory is a multi-purpose factory for handling objects with single-value constructors, such as primitives.
 

Uses of SerialFactory in org.pojava.persistence.serial
 

Fields in org.pojava.persistence.serial with type parameters of type SerialFactory
 java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,SerialFactory<?>> XmlDefs.factories
          Factories define how objects are constructed.
 

Methods in org.pojava.persistence.serial that return SerialFactory
 SerialFactory<?> XmlDefs.factory(java.lang.Class<?> type)
          Return a registered factory (or null if unregistered)
 

Methods in org.pojava.persistence.serial with parameters of type SerialFactory
 void XmlDefs.registerFactory(java.lang.Class<?> type, SerialFactory<?> factory)
          You can add or override your own custom factory for each type.
